description: Increasing the availability of sexual assault nurse examiners.

original.text:
H-0221.1
HOUSE BILL 1049
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Shavers, Leavitt, Berry, Reed, Doglio, Fosse, Simmons, Goodman, Wylie, Pollet, Duerr, Nance, Davis, Ormsby, Reeves, and Hill
Prefiled 12/12/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Appropriations.
AN ACT Relating to increasing the availability of sexual assault nurse examiners; and adding a new section to chapter 43.70 RCW.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. A new section is added to chapter 43.70 RCW to read as follows:
(1) Subject to the availability of amounts appropriated for this specific purpose, the department shall establish a stipend program to defray the out-of-pocket expenses incurred by registered nurses completing the training necessary to become adult/adolescent or pediatric sexual assault nurse examiners.
(2) The total amount of the stipend for any individual nurse may not exceed $2,500.
(3) For purposes of this section, "out-of-pocket expenses" include:
(a) Fees, tuition, educational materials, or other charges imposed by the entity providing training;
(b) Reasonable travel expenses, including air travel, rental car costs, mileage on a personal vehicle, lodging, and meals; and
(c) Any other expenses deemed appropriate by the department.
(4) The department may adopt any rules necessary to implement this section.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The purpose of House Bill 1049 is to increase the availability of sexual assault nurse examiners in Washington State. The bill aims to support registered nurses in obtaining the necessary training to become certified in this crucial role. The key change from prior legislation is the establishment of a stipend program to help cover training costs, which is designed to encourage more nurses to enter this field and ultimately improve services for sexual assault survivors.

Key Provisions

Stipend Program

  • The Department of Health will create a stipend program for registered nurses who complete training to become adult/adolescent or pediatric sexual assault nurse examiners, contingent on funding.
  • Each nurse may receive up to $2,500 to defray out-of-pocket costs related to training.
  • Out-of-pocket expenses covered by the stipend may include:
    • Training fees, tuition, educational materials, and other charges imposed by the training provider.
    • Reasonable travel expenses such as air travel, rental car costs, mileage on personal vehicles, lodging, and meals.
    • Additional expenses deemed appropriate by the Department.
  • The Department of Health has the authority to adopt rules necessary for implementing this stipend program.

keywords.text: sexual assault nurse examiners stipend program training costs registered nurses certification educational materials expenses travel lodging meals
